isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - HEHR POWER SYSTEMS/POWERLINE ALTERNATORS USED ON EMERGENCY VEHICLES - TESTING AND ANALYSIS OF CHARGING SYSTEM - UPGRADING THE ALTERNATOR

svcproc.title: UPGRADING THE ALTERNATOR
svcproc.para: Discharge currents greater than 20 amps usually require a larger alternator to solve the problem. Keep in mind that the Series 25, 250 amp alternator only outperforms the 190 or 200 at alternator speeds above 3000 RPM. Increasing the pulley ratio is necessary if it is not correct.

Hehr Power Systems recommends the maximum load on an alternator should not exceed 80% of its 200°F (93°C) rating (reference the power curves in Section 8.0.) at the speed of use. This allows a 20% margin of error to account for higher temperature, low voltage, belt wear, etc.
Replacing a smaller alternator with the 250 amp model will require a battery cable upgrade and possibly an isolator upgrade (if equipped).

If you find a serious overload, the alternator upgrade may be the best solution. Anything less may result in a burned up alternator (due to the heat caused by a constant full field condition) or the destruction of expensive equipment.
